Package com.peyrona.mingle.lang.japi

Class RateMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.peyrona.mingle.lang.japi.RateMonitor
  • public class RateMonitor
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is designed to detect if events are happening too fast.
    It stores a specified number of event timestamps and checks if the time elapsed between the first and last event is equal to or exceeds a specified threshold.
    Author:
    Francisco Jos√© Morero Peyrona Official web site at: https://github.com/peyrona/mingle

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      RateMonitor​(int maxEvents, long timeThresholdMillis)
      Constructs an EventRateMonitor with the specified maximum number of events and the time threshold to consider events as happening too fast.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void clear()
      Clears all stored event timestamps.
      long getFirst()
      Returns the timestamp of the first event in the queue.
      long getLast()
      Returns the timestamp of the last event in the queue.
      boolean isElapsedFromFirst​(long millis)
      Checks if the elapsed time since the first event is equal to or exceeds the specified milliseconds.
      boolean isElapsedFromLast​(long millis)
      Checks if the elapsed time since the last event is equal to or exceeds the specified milliseconds.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the event queue is empty.
      boolean notifyTooFast()
      Notifies the monitor of a new event.
      This method stores the current timestamp and checks if the events are happening too fast based on the configured threshold.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RateMonitor

        public RateMonitor​(int maxEvents,
                   long timeThresholdMillis)
        Constructs an EventRateMonitor with the specified maximum number of events and the time threshold to consider events as happening too fast.
        Parameters:
        maxEvents - The maximum number of events to store.
        timeThresholdMillis - The time threshold in milliseconds to consider events as happening too fast.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If maxEvents or timeThresholdMillis is less than or equal to 0.

    • Method Detail

      • notifyTooFast

        public boolean notifyTooFast()
        Notifies the monitor of a new event.
        This method stores the current timestamp and checks if the events are happening too fast based on the configured threshold.
        Returns:
        true if there are enough events and the time elapsed between the first and last event is equal to or exceeds the specified threshold; false otherwise.

      • getFirst

        public long getFirst()
        Returns the timestamp of the first event in the queue.
        Returns:
        The timestamp of the first event, or 0 if the queue is empty.

      • getLast

        public long getLast()
        Returns the timestamp of the last event in the queue.
        Returns:
        The timestamp of the last event, or 0 if the queue is empty.

      • isElapsedFromLast

        public boolean isElapsedFromLast​(long millis)
        Checks if the elapsed time since the last event is equal to or exceeds the specified milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        millis - The time in milliseconds to compare against.
        Returns:
        true if the elapsed time since the last event is equal to or exceeds the specified milliseconds; false otherwise or if the queue is empty.

      • isElapsedFromFirst

        public boolean isElapsedFromFirst​(long millis)
        Checks if the elapsed time since the first event is equal to or exceeds the specified milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        millis - The time in milliseconds to compare against.
        Returns:
        true if the elapsed time since the first event is equal to or exceeds the specified milliseconds; false otherwise or if the queue is empty.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Checks if the event queue is empty.
        Returns:
        true if the queue is empty; false otherwise.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears all stored event timestamps. This can be used to reset the monitor.
